Submodules

peppermining.filters.case_activity_filter module

class peppermining.filters.case_activity_filter.CaseActivityFilter(data: PepperMining | PepperFilter, activities: list | None, mode: str | None = 'contain')[source]

Bases: PepperFilter

Filter on activities.

The filter keeps only the cases that with specific activities.

get_filter()[source]

Return the filters apply in the object.

Example

>>> pm = PepperMining()
>>> pm.read_event_log_csv("/tests/data/eventlog-example.csv", separator=';', format_date='%d/%m/%Y %H:%M')
>>> pm.read_cases_csv("/tests/data/case-example.csv", separator=';')
>>> f1 = CaseActivityFilter(pm, ['examine casually', 'check ticket'])
>>> f1.get_event_log()
>>> f2 = CaseActivityFilter(f1, ['reject request'], 'not contain')
>>> f2.get_event_log()
>>> f2.get_filter()
get_filter() → str[source]

Return the filters apply in the object.

Returns:

String with list the filters.

Return type:

String

peppermining.filters.case_between_time_filter module

class peppermining.filters.case_between_time_filter.CaseBetweenTimeFilter(data: PepperMining | PepperFilter, start_time: datetime64 = numpy.datetime64('1677-09-21T00:12:43.145224'), end_time: datetime64 = numpy.datetime64('2262-04-11T23:47:16.854775'))[source]

Bases: PepperFilter

Filter the cases between on time frame.

Keep the cases that are starting in a specific interval time frame.

get_filter()[source]

Return the filters apply in the object.

Example

>>> pm = PepperMining()
>>> pm.read_event_log_csv("/tests/data/eventlog-example.csv", separator=';', format_date='%d/%m/%Y %H:%M')
>>> pm.read_cases_csv("/tests/data/case-example.csv", separator=';')
>>> f1 = CaseBetweenTimeFilter(pm, '2022-02-02T00:00:00', '2022-02-04T23:59:59')
>>> f1.get_event_log()
>>> f2 = CaseFilter(f1, [4,5])
>>> f2.get_filter()

peppermining.filters.pepper_filter module

class peppermining.filters.pepper_filter.PepperFilter(pepper_data: Pepper)[source]

Bases: Pepper

The PepperFilter declares common operations for the Filters of PepperMining.

PepperMining has various specific methods to filter an event log: (1) Case Filter: The case filter keeps only the cases included in a list. (2) Case Size Filter: The case size filter keeps only the cases in the log with a number of events included in a range specified. (3) Filter the cases between on time frame: Keep the cases that are starting in a specific interval time frame. (4) Filter on start activities: The filter keeps only the cases that start with specific activities. (5) Filter on end activities: The filter keeps only the cases that end with specific activities. (6) Activity selection: Select cases that flow or don’t flow through specified activities. (7) Variant Filter: Keep the cases and logs that are in specified variants.

_component

PepperMining or PepperFilter object.

Type:

peppermining.pepper.Pepper

_mode

Modality of filtering (‘contain’ or ‘not contain’).

Type:

str

component()

The Decorator delegates all work to the wrapped component.

get_filter()[source]

Decorator (get_filter) that call parent implementation of the operation, instead of calling the wrapped object directly.

set_event_data_by_case_list()[source]

Filters the event log that keeps only the cases included in case list.

set_case_data_by_case_list()[source]

Filters the cases data that included in case list.

property component: Pepper

The Decorator delegates all work to the wrapped component.

Returns:

PepperMining or PepperFilter object.

Return type:

Pepper

get_filter() → str[source]

Decorator (get_filter) that call parent implementation of the operation, instead of calling the wrapped object directly.

Return type:

String

peppermining.filters.variant_filter module

class peppermining.filters.variant_filter.VariantFilter(data: PepperMining | PepperFilter, variant_list: str, mode: str | None = 'contain')[source]

Bases: PepperFilter

Variant Filter.

The variant filter keeps only the variants included in a list.

get_filter()[source]

Return the filters apply in the object.

Example

>>> pm = PepperMining()
>>> pm.read_event_log_csv("tests/data/eventlog-example.csv", separator=';', format_date='%d/%m/%Y %H:%M')
>>> pm.read_cases_csv("tests/data/case-example.csv", separator=';')
>>> var = PepperVariant(pm)
>>> variant_list = list(var.get_variants().iloc[0:2]['key'])
>>> f1 = VariantFilter(var, variant_list)
>>> f1.get_event_log()
>>> variant_list = list(var.get_variants().iloc[0:1]['key'])
>>> f2 = VariantFilter(f1, variant_list, "not contain")
>>> f2.get_event_log()
>>> f2.get_filter()
get_filter() → str[source]

Return the filters apply in the object.

Returns:

String with list the filters.

Return type:

String
